action.name: Shred file
action.command: zenity --question --title "Are you sure?" --text='Are you sure you want to shred it?'; [[ $? = 0 ]] && shred -fuz %F;

action.name: Rename to lower-case
action.command: for file in %N; do mv "$file" "$(echo "$file" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')"; done
action.description: Rename the currently selected files, making the filenames lower-case.

action.name: Slugify Filename
action.command: for file in %N; do mv "$file" "$(echo "$file" | tr -s ' ' | tr ' A-Z' '-a-z' | tr -s '-' | tr -c '[:alnum:][:cntrl:].' '-')"; done
action.description: Rename the currently selected files, making the filenames lower-case & replacing spaces with dashes.

action.name: Optimize with jpegoptim
action.command: for file in %F; do jpegoptim --strip-all -of "$file"; done
action.description: Losslessly optimize JPEGs, by optimizing the Huffman tables and stripping comments and EXIF metadata from the file.

action.name: Optimize with optipng
action.command: for i in %F; do optipng -o5 -quiet -preserve "$i"; done

action.name: Remove exif
action.command: for file in %F; do mogrify -strip "$file"; done

action.name: Convert to jpg
action.command: for file in %F; do name=$(zenity --text "Enter a name for the images from $file" --entry-text "$file.jpg" --entry) ; convert -density 300 "$file" "$name"; done

action.name: Convert to pdf
action.command: name=$(zenity --text "Enter a name for the pdf" --entry-text "combined.pdf" --entry) ; convert -compress jpeg %F $name
